result.execSummary:
The defendant Montrei Jamar Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concurrent with: With any sentence, credit for 5 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montrei Jamar Scott

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Montrei Jamar Scott in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to any sentence, credit for 5 days served.

Court ordered defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA, by 12-01-2020.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Montrei Jamar Scott not in court, in custody at Washington County and not produced.  William P Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nm
For reasons stated on the record defense requests plea and sentencing hearing. Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 16, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Montrei Jamar Scott not in court, in custody at DCI and not produced.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nm
Case calendared for plea and sentencing. Defense has received a new offer and requests a status to allow time to speak with defendant. Court orders case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.
  Status conference scheduled for January 3, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Same conditions to apply.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Defense counsel advised the Court that the defendant is in custody in Washington County.  Court ordered the warrant canceled and bond reinstated.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj

Defendant Montrei Jamar Scott not in court.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Montrei Jamar Scott not in court, in custody.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Case called at the request of defense counsel.  The State's file is not in court.  Defense counsel advised the Court that the defendant is in custody in Washington County on case 16CF000165.  Court ordered the warrant canceled and bail reinstated.  Defense requested a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case set for Final Pretrial. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. On the State's motion, Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court vacates 8/3/2016 jury trial date.

Defendant Montrei Jamar Scott in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 21. Any motions are to be filed by 6/21/2016.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Neosha S. or the address listed on the criminal complaint.

Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
